title: Significant Chemical/HazMat Spill
description: Industrial or laboratory setting, requiring rapid containment and evacuation.
stats:
• 190,000+ chemical incidents annually in US
• 30,000+ injuries per year
• $500M+ in damages
• Manufacturing/labs highest risk
• 60% occur due to human error
scoringDimensions: Containment Speed, Evacuation Safety, PPE Adherence

title: Gas Leak Response
description: Residential or commercial building, requiring ventilation and source shut-off.
stats:
• 300+ deaths annually from gas leaks
• 15,000+ injuries per year
• $100M+ property damage
• Natural gas/propane most common
• 80% preventable with proper response

title: Cardiac Arrest
description: A 55-year-old male has collapsed in a crowded shopping mall. He is unconscious, with shallow breathing and a weak pulse. Immediate action is required.

stats.common_info: Crowded area, multiple witnesses, AED available nearby.

scoringDimensions: CPR Quality, AED Application Speed, Crowd Management

title: Fire Emergency Response
description: Office or commercial setting, requiring fire suppression and rapid evacuation.
stats:
• 3,340 workplace fires daily
• 200+ deaths, 5,000+ injuries yearly
• $2.3B annual damage
• Leading cause: electrical (23%)
• OSHA requires evacuation training
scoringDimensions: Alarm Activation Speed, Extinguisher Use, Evacuation Path

title: Electrical Hazard Response
description: Workplace or construction site, requiring immediate power shut-off and PPE.
stats:
• 300+ electrocution deaths annually
• 4,000+ non-fatal injuries
• #5 cause of workplace deaths
• Construction industry: 52% of deaths
• 80% involve power lines/equipment
scoringDimensions: Power Deactivation, PPE Usage, Hazard Isolation
